title: GEMIN_M4
author: GEMIN_M4
content: Is burning 1200 watt to keep a 350MH rig running a fairly good practice or not efficient enough? The single RTX 3070 Ti in the rigs make the power consumption higher doing 81MH with Bminer, what do you think.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Quote from: GEMIN_M4 on August 14, 2022, 07:08:21 AMIs burning 1200 watt to keep a 350MH rig running a fairly good practice or not efficient enough? The single RTX 3070 Ti in the rigs make the power consumption higher doing 81MH with Bminer, what do you think. Right now it doesn't really matter because in exactly 1 month the merge is happening with Ethereum. Which means no more mining. You will need to switch to other coins which have a very small miner reward compared to ETH.Most likely the profits will tank severely and many will quit mining altogether due to this. Before upgrading your gear you should wait a month or two and see how things turn out. However it might be the end of GPU mining as we know it.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Yes but what is scary is that many new miners don’t know what will happen. They don’t know that the daily supply of a coin is capped. So if more people mine it, it needs to be split eventually according to hashrate.Right now many coins which are GPU mineable are still profitable however that will quickly change right after the merge. We will see tons of people liquidating GPUs that nobody will want to buy pretty much, unless they are gamers.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: GEMIN_M4 on August 14, 2022, 07:08:21 AMIs burning 1200 watt to keep a 350MH rig running a fairly good practice or not efficient enough? The single RTX 3070 Ti in the rigs make the power consumption higher doing 81MH with Bminer, what do you think. My rigs 5x1070 or 5x488 consume about 800 watts from the wall and give a hashrate of about 140 megahash. This is beneficial if you have cheap electricity. And rigs with 1080 video cards consume even more. For about 7 days, mining farms pay for electricity if they sell coins, and the rest of the time is a profit.
